body: Are those figures without using rclone mount? If not can you try using rclone directly without FUSE and report the timings?
This is with the mount/FUSE option. Can you give me an example you'd like me to test?

rename.from: Better transfer speed with crypt while using seek
rename.to: FUSE: Better transfer speed with crypt while using seek

body:
1.33-52
I wanna say first off my speeds stink, due to my provider. i am talking like 10Mbps. 
I did a test with the same file. First using mounted crypt. It would bounce between 1-5Mbps and when i tried to sync it showed an updated image but never started playing again. 
Next i test with a mounted none crypt. Maybe just a smidge faster 2-5Mbps this time i could seek and it would take about 5 or 6 seconds and start playing again.
the final test was using cat file | vlc- This time i was receiving about 7Mbps steady. When i attempted a seek it just broke. 

This was on ubuntu 16.04 and used the default media player accept when i cat to vlc. 
Just my observations. nothing formal here and my speeds stink always not just with rclone :)

one last thing was did a download and saw the same pretty constant 7Mbps, which i guess was to be expected.

I've been playing around with this and I have the same problems. If I rclone mount both the Encrypted and Decrypted remotes and download with nginx (which I believe uses seek) I get:

Encrypted: 6 MB/s
Decrypted: 300 KB/s

This is not CPU related as the system is basically idle while these downloads are happening. I'm on 50mb/s internet at home so the 6MB/s figure above is essentially line speed. The slow speeds on the decrypted files means using vlc/kodi is basically unusable for higher bit rate files and buffers indefinately.

Happy to do any tests you may require to investigate this.

Thanks for the tests.

I'm not sure what is going on here!

Observations suggest it is most likely it is something to do with the crypt code and seeking but I haven't figured it out yet!

It could also be something that has changed (eg the fuse library I'm using) - I'll try to narrow it down more.

I don't think it's actually Crypt I think it's seek:

Copy/pasting a file from my Encrypted ACD mount I get speeds of 17MB/s when I try to play the video file with the built in video player I get 150-600 KB/s.

[EDIT]: Just saw the "crypt code and seeking" - missed the "and seeking" part.
One more test: I tried playing the same video file from my non-encrypted ACD mount and got 300-600KB/s. So Crypt didn't make much of a difference for me, just seeking.
Good results thanks. How are you measuring the speed while seeking? Maybe I need to write some benchmarks to formalise that.
I'm just watching Bmon for 60 seconds while performing these action..

Hi,
I'm also facing similar issue. 
I have set up rclone crypt + ACD for uploading data and rclone mount/FUSE to download.
While uploading data I get uploading speed of 10mbps [Max for my connection]
While copying/downloading data from mount point I get speed varying between 10mbps - 20mbps [Max down speed for my connection is 20mbps]
But while streaming a video from Plex using rclone FUSE mount point I get speed varying between 0.5mbps - 2mbps only. 

Note: Currently using rclone-v1.33-64 Beta version.

I have fixed this in : http://beta.rclone.org/v1.33-69-gd8d1102/ (will be uploaded in 15 mins)

There was a bug in the seek implementation which was causing it to seek on every read which really killed the performance.

I only figured out what was going on by playing videos from ACD with vlc - so thank you all for your tips.
YES! Thanks for your hard work @ncw! Very excited to implement this!

Thanks :) :)
Now I'm having a smooth playback from plex.

@ncw I've just installed this version and it doesn't seem to have made any difference for me :(

Additionally, I'm seeing errors in the rclone logs (only when seek is being used)

2016/10/22 22:16:55 Linux.iso: ReadFileHandle.Read error: file already closed
2016/10/22 22:17:18 Linux.iso: ReadFileHandle.Read error: file already closed

root@frog:~# rclone --version
rclone v1.33-69-gd8d1102Î²

issue.title: FUSE: Transfer speed with crypt while using seek and nginx

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
This issues seems to mostly be a repeat of #774 which appears to be fixed in some scenarios but not all. 

I have an encrypted mounted amazon cloud drive share which is available in nginx [as a directory listing] and have found the speed issue still exists here. File copies are between 100-400Kb/s where as copies from bash run at full speed.

Strangely, I can use other applications such as SCP and get full speed with this [where as I didn't pre v1.33-69-gd8d1102]. Other comments in that issue appear to suggest it has been fixed in other applications too. 

Is this something unique with the way nginx uses seek?
